text.text: How can I view a list of locked or suspended accounts?

text: You can view a list of locked or suspended accounts using the Account Locks and Suspensions report. To eliminate unnecessary information, you can use the suspension type or suspension reason filters.

text.text: What filters can I use to eliminate unnecessary information in the account locks and suspension report?

text: You can use the suspension type or suspension reason filters to eliminate unnecessary information in the Account Locks and Suspensions report.

text.text: Why is it important to manage locked or suspended accounts daily?

text: You cannot bill or post to locked or suspended accounts, so it is important that someone is working the issue(s) that lead to the lock or suspension. Ensure that someone is managing these accounts daily. To keep abreast of what's happening, try running this report weekly.

text.text: How often should I run the account locks and suspension report?

text: You can run the Account Locks and Suspensions report weekly.

text.text: Can you guide me through the process of lifting a patient's suspension?

text: To lift a patient's suspension, you can follow these steps: 1. Hover over Claims and select Patient Billing. 2. Click the Other suspensions tab. 3. Scroll down to find the patient name or filter the list by entering the patient's name in the box at the top of the 'Patient name' column. 4. Click the patient name to go to the Account page. At the top of the Account page, you will see a message that patient billing has been suspended. 5. Click the Edit suspension button on the yellow banner. 6. Click Remove suspension.

text.text: What actions should I take after identifying a locked or suspended account?

text: After you determine next steps, return to the "Final statement sent" tab to take action – send the patient another statement, move this account to a collection agency or state debt collections, or write the amount off as bad debt. Work this tab on a daily basis– you want it to be empty!.

text.text: What types of issues can lead to an account being locked or suspended?

text: Accounts can be locked or suspended for a number of reasons, including:

text.text: How does managing locked or suspended accounts contribute to efficient billing processes?

text: You cannot bill or post to locked or suspended accounts so it is important that someone is working the issue(s) that lead to the lock or suspension. Ensure that someone is managing these accounts daily. To keep abreast of what's happening, try running this report weekly.

text.text: Can you explain the significance of reconciling locked or suspended accounts with daily operations?

text: You want to be able to work the issues that lead to the lock or suspension. You can lift a patient's suspension at any time. A user can manually suspend an account by clicking the "Review" icon and then the "Suspend patient billing" button. The reason for the suspension displays under the "Suspension reason" column. Accounts under this tab need to be worked daily.

text.text: What measures can be taken to prevent accounts from being locked or suspended in the future?

text: To keep abreast of what's happening, try running this report weekly.

text.text: What information is included in the accounts in collections report?

text: The Accounts in Collections report lists all accounts currently in collections, including: Claim numbers, the amount written-off or suspended, the outstanding debt, and the balance

text.text: How often should I use the accounts in collections report?

text: Use this internal report monthly to view how much is outstanding, how much was collected, and to reconcile your books with the collections agency or state debt program.

text.text: Why is it important to reconcile books with collections agencies or state debt programs?

text: To manage the information within the report, export the information to Excel by clicking the print icon and selecting Excel.

text.text: How can I export information from the accounts in collections report to Excel?

text: To manage the information within the report, export the information to Excel by clicking the print icon and selecting Excel. You can then change, rearrange, and delete data as needed before sending it to the agency.

text.text: What actions should I take after reviewing the accounts in collections report?

text: To move an account to collections, you can click the Move to collections button. You can also create a new collection agency. You can select one or more accounts to move to collections. The account must be in a Collection letter sent or Final statement sent status. You can run the Accounts in Collections report to view all accounts currently in collections. This report lists accounts sent to both the collection agency and state debt collections. You can export the information to Excel by clicking the print icon and selecting Excel. You can then change, rearrange, and delete data as needed before sending it to the agency.

text.text: How do I interpret the data provided in the accounts in collections report?

text: The Accounts in Collections report lists all accounts currently in collections, including claim numbers, the amount written-off or suspended, the outstanding debt, and the balance. You can run the report by clicking the Accounts in Collections link under Reports. You can then export the information to Excel by clicking the print icon and selecting Excel. You can then change, rearrange, and delete data as needed before sending it to the agency.

text.text: How does the accounts in collections report contribute to financial management?

text: The Accounts in Collections report can be used to view how much is outstanding, how much was collected, and to reconcile your books with the collections agency or state debt program. You can run the report monthly to view this information.

text.text: Can you provide examples of situations where the accounts in collections report is beneficial?

text: The Accounts in Collections report can be used to view how much is outstanding, how much was collected, and to reconcile your books with the collections agency or state debt program. You can run the report monthly to view this information.

text.text: What information is provided in the send to collections report?

text: The Send to Collections report lists those accounts and provides detailed information required by collections or state debt collections. To run the report: 1. On the navigation bar, hover over Analytics and click Reports. 2. Scroll down the list and click Send to Collections. 3. Select: Click this field and then select either Accounting Period or Deposit Date. 4. Accounting Period: Click this field to select one or more (or ALL) accounting periods. 5. Deposit Start and End Date: Click each field to select the deposit start and ends dates. 6. Click View Report.

text.text: Why is it recommended to run the send to collections report at the end of the month?

text: It is recommended to run the Send to Collections report at the end of the month because it lists those accounts and provides detailed information required by collections or state debt collections.

text.text: How can I send the report to collections agencies or state debt programs?

text: To manage the information within the report, export the information to Excel by clicking the print icon and selecting Excel. You can then change, rearrange, and delete data as needed before sending it to the agency.

text.text: What actions should be taken after generating the send to collections report?

text: To manage the information within the report, export the information to Excel by clicking the print icon and selecting Excel. You can then change, rearrange, and delete data as needed before sending it to the agency.

text.text: How can I manage the information within the report before sending it to the agency?

text: To manage the information within the report, export the information to Excel by clicking the print icon and selecting Excel. You can then change, rearrange, and delete data as needed before sending it to the agency.

text.text: Can you explain the process of moving accounts to collections or state debt collections?

text: To move an account to collections, click Move to collections and select a collection agency. To move an account to state debt collections, select the state from the drop-down list and click Confirm. The status for all claims in the account with the patient as the current payer changes to "Suspended - In state debt collections".

text.text: What detailed information is required by collections or state debt collections?

text:
The Send to Collections report lists those accounts and provides detailed information required by collections or state debt collections. This information includes:

* Claim numbers
* Amount written-off or suspended
* Outstanding debt
* Balance

text.text: How does the send to collections report facilitate the collections process?

text: The Send to Collections report lists those accounts and provides detailed information required by collections or state debt collections. This information includes: * Claim numbers * Amount written-off or suspended * Outstanding debt * Balance

text.text: What role does the send to collections report play in revenue management?

text: The Send to Collections report lists those accounts and provides detailed information required by collections or state debt collections. This information includes: * Claim numbers * Amount written-off or suspended * Outstanding debt * Balance

text.text: What information is included in the repeat customers report?

text: The Repeat Customers report shows a list of customers that used your service more than once and the level of service for each claim. The report lists the customers with the highest number of claims first, followed by the lowest.

text.text: How often should I use the repeat customers report?

text: The Repeat Customers report should be used daily. This report can be used to target potential enrollees and identify customers that may need assistance from agencies or support organizations.

text.text: How can the repeat customers report be used to target potential enrollees in a repeat customer program?

text: The Repeat Customers report can be used to target potential enrollees in a repeat customer program. The report lists the customers with the highest number of claims first, followed by the lowest.

text.text: What actions can be taken based on the information provided in the repeat customers report?

text: The Repeat Customers report can be used to identify customers that may need assistance from agencies or support organizations.

text.text: What information is displayed in the membership tracking report?

text: The Membership Tracking report displays a list of all patients participating in your membership program. It includes the membership start/stop date and the number of claims opened during their membership.

text.text: How do I access the membership tracking report?

text: To access the Membership Tracking report, you can: 1. On the navigation bar, hover over Analytics and click Reports. 2. Scroll down the list and click Membership Tracking. 3. Enter the report's start and end date and then click View Report.

text.text: What actions should I take after viewing the membership tracking report?

text: If you have a repeat customer program, you can use the information in the Membership Tracking report to target potential enrollees. You can also identify customers that may need assistance from agencies or support organizations.

text.text: How can the membership tracking report help in managing patient memberships?

text: The Membership Tracking report can help you manage patient memberships by providing information such as: Membership start/stop date Number of claims opened during membership Total charges Balance due Balance in collections

text.text: Can you explain the significance of tracking membership start/stop dates and claim openings?

text: The Membership Tracking report can help you manage patient memberships by providing information such as: Membership start/stop date Number of claims opened during membership Total charges Balance due Balance in collections

text.text: What is Account Locks and Suspensions?

text: Account Locks and Suspensions lists all suspended accounts including the suspension date and reason for suspension. You can start by selecting a date range and use the suspension type or suspension reason filters to eliminate unnecessary information.

text.text: What is the use of Account Locks and Suspensions?

text: You cannot bill or post to locked or suspended accounts so it is important that someone is working the issue(s) that lead to the lock or suspension.

text.text: How to lift a patient's suspension in accounts report?

text: To lift a patient's suspension, you can: 1. Hover over Claims and select Patient Billing 2. Click the Other suspensions tab 3. Scroll down to find the patient name or filter the list by entering the patient's name in the box at the top of the 'Patient name' column 4. Click the patient name to go to the Account page 5. At the top of the Account page, you will see a message that patient billing has been suspended 6. Click the Edit suspension button on the yellow banner 7. Click Remove suspension

text.text: Explain Accounts in Collections?

text: Accounts in Collections lists all claims sent to a collection agency or state debt collections. To see all the accounts currently in collections, try running the "Accounts in Collections" report. This report lists accounts sent to both the collection agency and state debt collections.

text.text: What is Repeat Customers?

text: Repeat Customers shows a list of customers that used your service more than once and the level of service for each claim. The report lists the customers with the highest number of claims first, followed by the lowest.

text.text: What is the use of Repeat Customers?

text: If you have a repeat customer program, use the information in this report to target potential enrollees. Identify customers that may need assistance from agencies or support organizations.

text.text: What is Membership Tracking report?

text: The Membership Tracking report displays a list of all patients participating in your membership program. It includes the membership start/stop date and the number of claims opened during their membership.

text.text: How to run Membership Tracking report?

text: To run the Membership Tracking report, you can: 1. On the navigation bar, hover over Analytics and click Reports. 2. Scroll down the list and click Membership Tracking. 3. Enter the start and end date and then click View Report.
